name: Hilton Minneapolis/St. Paul Airport Mall of America

reviews.text: I've been staying here annually for almost 20 years. It is an older hotel that was built during the times of larger hotel rooms. But don't let the structural age fool you! The management have spent enough resources in keeping this hotel in great shape and modern. The two whirlpool areas couple with the atrium pool are a pleasant getaway.
reviews.title: Consistent Quality

reviews.text: The slight drawback is the small Executive Lounge area on the 12th floor. It usually gets quite congested during peak times. However with some strategic planning, you can make the most of it with the panoramic views of the airport and city.
reviews.title: Most appalling service ever

reviews.text: (HHonors: lounge access + internet)
reviews.title: Nice big rooms!

reviews.text: Quite simply, in many years of international corporate travel the worst experience and customer service I have ever had the misfortune to encounter. After a long standing corporate reservation we were bumped for a group booking, even though we had confirmations for the room. The 'hotel' relocated us to a cheaper hotel son they could accommodate their newly booked group rather than our booking. Discriminatory and unacceptable and altogether rude. If you have a booking here don't trust that you will get the reservation you booked for.
reviews.title: Go for it!

reviews.text: We had an very nice stay , the rooms were very large and nice. Parking was ok, very full. The food was good and the bar was nice.
reviews.title: Nothing Special
Nice Stay
reviews.text: First time staying at this property, not as new as the other Hilton in Bloomington, but still a good Hilton experience. Close to MSP, easy parking, close to Mall Of America and IKEA.

Hotel was very close to airport. Check-in was quick and smooth. Staff was very helpful. I thought it odd that there was a large family reunion going on in the conference room on the Honors floor (usually reserved for business people) with lots of kids running around being kids. As I had dinner reservations with some work associates, I didn't think much of the reunion since I was sure it would be ended by the time I got back to my room.
reviews.title: No A/C and a family reunion on the business floor?!?

reviews.text: I also noticed my room was uncomfortably warm when I changed for dinner, so I turned down the A/C, as it was unseasonably hot in Minneapolis that week.
reviews.title: Great Property - Great People

reviews.text: BUT...when I returned to my room just before midnight, the room was still in the 80's?!? I actually left my door open for a while to cool it down. Worse, someone must have been aware of the problem as there was a box fan in the closet. At a Hilton?!?
reviews.title: Nice and friendly Hotel

reviews.text: I checked out a day early and the desk clerk was good enough not to charge me for the canceled night, only the night I'd stayed. But this is not what I've come to expect from Hilton.
reviews.title: I have found my favorite MSP airport hotel..

reviews.text: I checked in to the Hilton MSP at the last minute, due to Hurricane Irene. Check in was fast. The room was beautiful - large, clean and comfortable. As a Hilton Honors member I had access to the executive lounge, where I had a wonderful breakfast with a great view of the city skyline. The staff was friendly and I will definitely stay at the Hilton again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel near the airport

reviews.text: Ok, another business trip, another good stay at a Hilton. Clean hotel, although the meal from the restaurant, which I ate at the bar, was too gamey. It was Venison, but it was not very good and the white asparagus looking things were pretty bland.
reviews.title: All of my reviews are starting to sound the same
Nice quiet room with "key" issues!
reviews.text: The rooms are typical Hilton - clean. The beds were comfortable, but the service messed up at the end: I asked that they email me my folio, but they never did. Too bad because the front desk was rather helpful.
So, it is a clean hotel, close to the airport, with friend staff. If they had better memories I would have rated this above average.
reviews.title: Great Location and Value

reviews.text: Room was a king size at the end of the floor. It seems like everytime I used my key card it would take 10 to 12 tries to open the door. I even went to the front desk twice for them to reformat the code!! Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and accommodating. The 12th floor lounge staff was very nice. Too bad not in a bigger room but I guess they don't want everyone there!! Enjoyed the shuttle to the mall of america.
reviews.title: Location, location, location...

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the hilton. The room was contemporary as are the furnishings in the room and hotel as a whole. The room was clean. The beds were ok, newer mattresses, just not real firm. The front desk staff was professional and helpful. Loved the warm water pool and two hot tubs.
reviews.title: Great Service and Excellent Value

reviews.text: My husband and I generally stay here if we have an early flight out the next morning; it's close to the airport and they have a great park and fly service. We generally have a good experience. I stayed solo a few nights ago and had an issue with the TV. The desk not only sent someone up ASAP but the desk called back later to ensure the TV was working. I really appreciated their followup because, sometimes at other places, it seems as if they really don't care about the customer's experience.
reviews.title: Outstanding service on my last stay

reviews.text: Also, wifi is included for all Hilton Honors members, I believe.
reviews.title: Great and Convenient stay

reviews.text: We spent a Saturday night at this hotel close to Minneapolis Airport. We were attending an event there and it turned out to be very convenient for us. We had breakfast at the Exec. floors lounge on 12th floor. Good noising proofing and we couldn't even tell we were close to the Airport.
reviews.title: This is supposed to be nice right?

reviews.text: The pool could be a bit bigger for this size of hotel. There is a lot of parking space and it is free. Everybody was very friendly.
reviews.title: Great stay

aka: Hilton Minneapolis/St. Paul Airport Mall Of America Hotel Bloomington
description: Hilton Minneapolis/St. Paul Airport Mall of America is set apart from other Bloomington, MN hotels by its commitment to customer service and environmental stewardship. Situated adjacent to the Minnesota Valley National Wildlife Refuge, this Hilton hotel provides a unique sense of peace in the Bloomington, MN area. We offer complimentary shuttle service to the nearby Mall of America and Minneapolis/St. Paul International Airport (MSP). Close to the Light Rail Transit system, guests have convenient access to downtown Minneapolis and a variety of professional sporting events at Target Field, Target Center, and Mall of America Field. While at the hotel, be sure to savor Blue Water Grill’s award-winning steaks or seafood entrees and admire the nature photography on display, all created by Executive Chef Eric G Baker. And to make your stay comfortable and convenient, we offer great amenities such as the glass-enclosed atrium recreation area with a heated indoor pool, two whirlpools, 24-hour fitness center and complimentary parking.
